cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss the use of body language across various situations.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss how body language affects relationships.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject work or discourse primarily concerns or discusses the object topic or domain.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.
args.justification: Both relations link the same type of subject (an essay/document) to what it discusses, i.e., the topic or subject matter. They already share the canonical_rel_name 'is_about' and belong to the ABOUTNESS group. Unifying the canonical_rel_desc and rel_cls to 'document_subject_relation' removes minor inconsistencies between 'document_subject_relation' and 'subject_matter_relation' while clearly expressing that the subject is a document.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations link the same type of subject (an essay/document) to what it discusses, i.e., the topic or subject matter. They already share the canonical_rel_name 'is_about' and belong to the ABOUTNESS group. Unifying the canonical_rel_desc and rel_cls to 'document_subject_relation' removes minor inconsistencies between 'document_subject_relation' and 'subject_matter_relation' while clearly expressing that the subject is a document.
